title: Introducing Block-Ops
body:
Over the last few years, I have noticed pain-points in the paradigm that exists between work that needs to be done and the people who can do it. From a developerâ€™s perspective, they often spend months studying for Certifications or to score highly on a LeetCode or HackerRank test. At the same time, companies are hiring folks to source & recruit to get candidates into interviews where in-house technologists attempt to evaluate candidatesâ€™ skill set in a few hours.

Block-Ops, now released on the Kovan Testnet, is here to solve these problems by directly connecting do-ers with what needs to be done. Anyone in the world is able to create a project and **stake a bounty** within it. Similarly, everyone is able to submit their solution for a project. **All of these Projects and Submissions** are **standard ERC-721 NFTs** and payments are handled via decentralized smart contracts on the Ethereum Blockchain.

## Why Block-Ops?

### Project Managers

The traditional hiring method of sourcing, recruiting, & interviewing candidates is a long and costly process, and even once completed, you entrust a single developer to provide a solution to a problem you have now. By utilizing Block-Ops, **you directly engage the entire world of developers to solve your problem**, circumventing the recruiting process altogether. Best of all, if on the odd chance your project cannot be completed, you are **free to pull your funds out at any time!**

**This gives you the benefits of open-sourcing your code, without needing to open-source your code.**

### Developers

We have designed our smart contracts as ERC-721 NFTs that **double as decentralized escrow** accounts. Upon creation of a contract, the creator (Project Manager) stores a bounty inside the NFT and upon completion of work, the **developer can redeem these funds as payment**.

Alongside the monetary incentive, the NFT serves as a *proof-of-work* done that the developer will carry with them forever. This can be displayed on a resume, social media profile, and even on Block-Ops!

## Data Storage

We utilize both IPFS and Filecoin to store all Projects and Submissions, meaning you will never need to worry about accidentally misplacing or even deleting old code. Upon either Project Creation or Solution submission, the associated metadata and images are uploaded to IPFS then Filecoin. Once uploaded, you will be able to see your NFT in your Wallet. Check out our guide on adding the BlockOps NFT to your Web3 Wallet: 

[https://block-ops.xyz/info](https://block-ops.xyz/info)

## Next Steps

### BlockOpsDao

The next thing we will begin working on is formalizing a DAO which will be regulated via our Block-Ops Token. The DAO itself will be responsible for setting and distributing platform fees to improve the Block-Ops service and create partnerships with other DAO's.

A fault in the insurance paradigm, especially in the United States, is benefits being tied to your employer. While Block-Ops directly solves the need for employment in terms of take-home-pay, it does not yet solve the insurance issue. That is why we are exploring a partnership with Opolis, a fantastic project that provides benefits to workers in the Web3 community such as:

1. Health, Vision, & Dental Insurance
2. FSA & HSA
3. Group 401(k), Solo 401(k), and IRA options

[https://opolis.co/](https://opolis.co/)

### Zero-Knowledge Proofs & Optimistic Rollups

If there is one thing we can take away from the madness of NFT Summer, itâ€™s that the Ethereum blockchain is not yet ready to handle hundreds of millions of concurrent users. While we always plan to use Ethereum as our settlement layer, we are exploring various ZK solutions such as [zkSync v2](https://v2.zksync.io/) and Optimistic Rollups like [Arbitrum](https://arbitrum.io/) or [Optimism](https://www.optimism.io/) so that we can continue delivering the Block-Ops platform with even lower fees. 

### Community Support Channel

Once we go live with the BlockOpsDao, we will create a managed Discord Server that will authenticate based on you having our governance token. This channel will be a fantastic home for collaboration between Developers and Project Managers. We will also use this channel to brainstorm ideas of how we can give back to the community. Some ideas we are already considering are an IRL Meet Up (with a virtual option), developing a dividend-paying NFT treasury, and helping cover the fees associated with a benefits provider like [Opolis.co](https://opolis.co/).

## Conclusion

Donâ€™t forget to check out our website [https://block-ops.xyz](https://block-ops.xyz/) and [follow us on twitter](https://twitter.com/dao_block?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw) for the latest information on the project. Also, [check out this Kovan ETH Faucet](https://faucets.chain.link/) from Chainlink to get some ETH to play with our dApp.

**Want to get in touch? [Shoot us a message on Twitter](https://twitter.com/dao_block?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)**

title: Why do p2e games need dynamic NFTs?
body:
![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/l4XxaWTZnvIdVjd3-eS26.png?height=960&width=1920)

### Ilya Zhurin, OG Protocol business development lead, answers this question.

## Dynamic NFTs in p2e games

Dynamic NFTs enable blockchain games to do more with their digital game assets. They allow users to experience a more realistic game flow, as NFTs evolve based on players' actions and respond to their progress. As a result, the gameplay feels more real, and players stay excited about coming back to play more and seeing their achievements reflected in their NFTs.

I believe that games with strong in-game economies can really do well to adopt dynamic NFTs. Also, with the right dynamic logic baked in the NFTs, interest in the secondary market can be high, leading to higher volume and royalties.

## Ideas on how to use dynamic NFT for p2e

All kinds of events may trigger the change of NFTs â€” currency rates, NFT price, usersâ€™ addresses, balances, in-app events, weather, sports newsâ€¦ Your imagination is the only limit. Here just some examples of how you can use this technology in p2e games:

â— Standard avatars evolve into mages, warriors, or miners after several in-game quests. Their appearance and stats change, giving each type certain advantages over others;

â— fighters get scars and bruises after a certain number of PVP fights;

â— swords and armor start shining with green light after enchanting;

â— avatars' faces turn sad when ETH drops below $2000;

â— rainy weather in real life reduces car speed in a racing game.

## Web3 current market state

The play-to-earn market is quite saturated, as many gaming projects compete for players' attention. Generous giveaways proved only to be a temporary solution for onboarding players, as they attract people who come for the money, not for the game. Such players leave for the next shiny thing as soon as in-game rewards dry up.

For a game to be successful in the long term, it should be interesting to play even without the rewards, though building such a game is challenging. This is why I believe that in the future we will see a lot of partnerships between Web2 gaming studios and Web3 projects. Teams that have both game-building and blockchain experience will have good chances to survive and thrive.

I also see more games trying to deliver interactive game-like interfaces even before the game is ready, giving users something to do with their digital assets, in turn keeping their audience engaged.

## How will the OG Protocol help p2e game developers solve their problems?

Game builders are looking for ways to boost user engagement and retention, as well as onboarding new users, and dynamic NFTs are a great way to achieve these goals. However, this is a relatively new technology, so the implementation may be challenging. Game development teams would need to hire additional developers and invest time and resources in implementation and ongoing support.

Our team has over 4 years and several dynamic NFT projects in our portfolio. So, we decided to start [OG Protocol](https://www.ogprotocol.com/) to enable web3 teams to achieve their business goals by helping them integrate 3D dynamic NFTs and ensuring smooth and hassle-free ongoing support of dynamic changes in their NFTs. With [OG Protocol](https://www.ogprotocol.com/) it can be done more efficiently compared to in-house support.

## The future of p2e games

I believe that in the near future more blockchain games will take advantage of dynamic NFTs. We're still in a very early stage and the awareness is relatively low. Some games are implementing dynamic NFTs already, and I see this trend picking up speed in the next 6-12 months. Evolving NFTs will bring blockchain gaming to the next level of interactivity, blurring the borders between games and life.

Before that, sprite also read a lot of bloggers' interpretations of web2 and web3 games. Many people will take the well-known King Glory as an example. King Glory players belong to consumption and pay to Tencent, but the money cannot be returned. In the eyes of people in the currency circle, there is no gold farming effect. But why does the King Glory live so well? The answer given by many bloggers is that it is fun and can bring spiritual enjoyment to people. I agree with this.

Next, these bloggers continued to give examples. If there is a 100% nano-replica web3 version of the King Glory, the gameplay is exactly the same as the glory of the king of web2, then now you spend 1,000 RMB to buy the skin, the skin first belongs to you, and then you can also slowly get pay back while playing. Most of this money is not given to Tencent, but is taken from players and used for players. So which would you choose?

The conclusion given by the bloggers is that everyone will prefer the Glory of the King of web3

But sprite donâ€™t think so. At first glance, there is nothing wrong with it, but if you think about it carefully, you will find that there are many paradoxes in it.

I think it's more like a plate. People put money in first, and then get it back little by little over time. Even after getting the principal back, you can get more profits.

Isn't this the obvious plate play? The predecessors make money from the later players. Is this the so-called take from the players and use it for the players? Why don't the predecessors build the bridge, and the latter pay the bill?

I think everyone once defined the web3 game, don't forget the success of web2, there is its inevitability, we should not completely ignore the properties of web2 while thinking about web3

So what do I think a successful web3 game should look like?

There must be levels, and there must be big brothers! The big brother is the main consumer in the game. The charge money strength of the big brother in traditional games is beyond people's imagination. It does not mean that the big brother is a fat sheep, and the investment cannot be recovered. It's the big brother in the game, who usually buys time, efficiency, and sense of achievement with money.

They don't plan carefully, and how to operate will return the money faster. For the big brother in the game, they enjoy the pleasure of paying for the bill. The same time invested in the game to calculate the income, it is better to put it into their business and there will be a faster return. So big brother is here to buy pleasure with money

Last year, many chain games targeted those bosses and asked them to invest millions and tens of millions, claiming that they would pay back their money in a few days. That is pure nonsense. Will the real rich believe it? As a result, it collapsed, and some big brothers made money. Whose money did they make?

A big brother of who has millions of money may cut hundreds of ordinary players, or it may be another big brother. So we must return to human nature. The real big brother's position in the game is the consumer, and this is not the battlefield for them to make money. They come to the game to spend money to save time, improve efficiency and get pleasure! Don't listen to that nonsense that the more you invest, the more you get paid.

So why is there less and less big brother in web2 games now? Is the big brother unwilling to play games, or is the big brother old and no energy to play?

Actually no, games are an excellent field of spiritual pastime for modern people. With the opening of powerful social attributes, games have no age span. They are not children's play as we understand them. They have become the entry of major international capital running the track.

So does it mean that the current economic environment is poor, and the big brothers have no money? In fact, believe that sentence, the rich may have no money one day, but there will never be a shortage of rich people in this world. In fact, the real reason why the big brother is reluctant to continue playing the game is actually that he has less companionship. **NFT proportional distribution:ï¼š**

NFT is the inheritance of the immortals of Eternal world. It is a creation token and can be pledged for mining.The total number of NFTs issued is 300,000, and the team retains 20%

Synthesis requires 2 NFTs of the same level to synthesize, and the synthesis rate of different levels is different. A failure to synthesize destroys an NFT, which creates a massive deflation. The higher the level of NFT, the lower the probability of synthesis, but at the same time the benefits will be super amplified

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VuTRdZbS-gJO8NpAemP8k.png?height=551&width=987)

Level 1 and Level 2 NFTs can get in-game airdrop blind boxes and game consumption spirit stones

NFTs above level 3 can not only get in-game airdrop blind boxes, but also pledge mining tokens. A total of 15% of the tokens can be obtained through NFT pledge. The higher the level of NFT, the more tokens obtained by pledge.

In addition to obtaining pledge tokens, level 5 NFTs also have exclusive monster spawning maps in the game scene. I think this gameplay is very novel and user-friendly. It has both the randomness of NFT blind box opening and the multi-functional properties of synthesis.

Players who have been drawn to Level 1 and Level 2 NFTs in this way, if they do not want to enter the game to play, can also synthesize Level 3 NFTs to pledge and mine tokens. The highest-level 5-level NFT can only be obtained through synthesis, which will keep the floor price of low-level NFTs rising.

The selling price of the blind box is only 10U, allowing more players to lower the threshold to participate. At the same time, the number of Level 5 NFTs is limited. When Level 5 NFTs have been synthesized and saturated, players can only buy from each other in the secondary market.

title: Build blockchain warehouse with Datawaves ETL
body:
Nowadays, Web3 startup teams have increasingly complex needs for handling blockchain data and are no longer satisfied with just building dashboards. For example, build machine learning models to serve prediction or recommendation scenarios, run graph analysis algorithms to find abnormal transaction addresses, or provide metrics data for upper-layer business. Whichever of the above methods means one must build a blockchain warehouse based on on-chain data.

But building a stable, easy-to-use blockchain warehouse is no easy task. `ethereum-etl` and `ethereum-etl-airflow` are two excellent open-source projects. Users can get full volume data directly through `ethereum-etl` and build a pipeline of T+1 data through `ethereum-etl-airflow`. However, having them alone is just half of the story.

## Build blockchain warehouse with open-source components

![Build Ethereum data warehouses with open-source ecosystems](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/J75NZMyNBNm4Kq5z1fchB.png?height=1152&width=2795)

This is a complete data processing pipeline:

* The user first needs an EVM node with all-history data and access to trace data (which is expensive)
* The data is then regularly synchronized to the data warehouse via `ethereum-etl-airflow` and subsequently decodes contracts.
  * `ethereum-etl-airflow` is an excellent library for most data extract and transformation needs. Still, one huge problem is that it is bound to the compute engine and currently only fully supports BigQuery requirements. So if you're not using Google Cloud, you'll need to re-implement the operator and contract decode logic.
  * Once the number of contract events/functions that need to be decoded rises to a certain level, it's not easy to keep these tasks scheduled and completed on time. Usually, the pipeline maintainer needs to have sufficient experience in Airflow and Kubernetes.
* Finally, the user will need to have another transform project to translate the activities emitted by the smart contract and model the upper-level business logic.

## Build blockchain warehouse with Datawaves ETL

![Build Ethereum data warehouses with Datawaves ETL](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3eJK2hfYeI4_QbDpplg77.png?height=1296&width=2913)

We are building **[Datawaves ETL](https://datawaves.xyz/etl)**, which integrates multiple standardized components to provide the ability to automatically synchronize data into the user's data warehouse, providing directly:

* EVM raw data (e.g., `transactions`, `traces`, `logs`, etc.)
* decoded contract data (e.g. `erc721_evt_transfer`, `opensea_WyvernExchangeV2_call_atomicMatch_` etc.)

The user only needs to provide the data warehouse connection URL, and cloud file system (e.g., AWS S3) configuration. And then, the cloud server can directly access and transform the data needed by the user into the user's data warehouse or s3 bucket daily and create tables in the data warehouse. It has the following advantages:

* You don't need to buy a node with all history and access to traces data (in QuickNode, this costs $500+/month)
* Extract the total amount of raw data very quickly at a meager cost (in QuickNode, it would be close to $2000+, with a higher machine cost to achieve a similar speed to ours)
  * QuickNode charges for the number of requests after the exceeded plan, and there is no batch extracting of traces in the EVM Node interface, so this data is costly to extract.
  * Because we already have data compressed using columnar storage, the block file is smaller and has fewer files to be transferred faster.
* Eliminating the need to maintain the underlying data ETL pipeline, which is standardized and tedious, leaving this to a cloud service that devotes more resources to work on the data movement and smart contract decoding, so your team can deliver business insights faster.
* The Airflow that schedules these tasks is cumbersome to maintain, and the more contracts that need to be decoded, the more tasks there are for the entire Airflow. Keeping an Airflow on the Kubernetes cluster with thousands of tasks running can also be a pain.
* Save the type design and namespace design work. We found many types of accuracy issues in building our data warehouse. These experiences are packaged in a complete solution for the user to use, and the user gets clean data that is the easiest to use in its data warehouse.
* Execution speed is essential in contract decoding. When there are thousands of events/functions to decode every day, it is not easy to ensure that the data is ready before the user uses it. Saving time in developing automated contract decoding tools, in the solution, we provide automated contract decoding tools that are 100 times faster than libraries like `web3.py`.
  * We have rewritten the entire decoding process in Java in the Spark engine, enabling a speedup of hundreds of times over the python implementation in high concurrency scenarios.

If youâ€™d like to play with Datawaves ETL, join our [waitlist](https://forms.gle/PSKJApvsjAvetA1r6), and ask any questions inÂ [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/22sQjRuYHR).

title: Our NFTX Vault; an intro
body:
The Vault is an NFTX-hosted vault that allows you to deposit your Pixlton NFTs in return for the PIXLS token. This token is tradeable on SushiSwap for Ethereum. The Vault tracks the floor value of Pixlton, which allows people who are looking to sell their Pixltonians to always be able to sell at floor price into The Vault. Because other NFT collectors can also buy from The Vault, this creates a liquidity pool that is always able to give you the floor value for your Pixltonians right then and there as opposed to listing them on OpenSea and having to wait for a buyer.

You can find our Vault here: <https://nftx.io/vault/0xf8eb56c7e4e3c885c905a19583bf41644d35aa0a/info/>

## Buying Pixltonians from The Vault

To buy Pixltonians from The Vault you will first need some ETH. After visiting our Vault using the URL above you can pick any Pixltonian youâ€™d like to have. Buying from The Vault also incurs a slight fee. There are two ways you can buy from The Vault: â€” Random redeem (1% fee, NFTX decides at random which Pixl you will get) â€” Targeted redeem (5% fee, You decide which Pixltonian you want at a slight premium)

If you want to do a random redeem, you can hit the â€œRedeemâ€ in the dialog on the right side of the screen and indicate how many Pixltonians you want to buy. title: Introducing: the Pixlton Identity Creator
body:
Our original project has always hugged that fine line between an avatar project and a PFP project. Due to their square size, they fit just fine as a PFP, but being full body makes them less than optimal for that. In the past, weâ€™ve released our *â€œnow suited for avatarâ€* variations of all of our Pixltonians but that was still kind of limited to what we had created. To finally scratch that PFP itch, weâ€™re now releasing the Pixlton Identity Creator (PIC)!

## What is it?

The PIC is a [new tool on our website](https://getpixls.com/pic) that allows you to connect to your wallet and create custom banners and avatars out of your Pixltonians. Simply drag one or more of your favorite citizens onto the canvas, select a background, and export the image. We currently support:

* Avatar format (square 1:1)
* Banner format (landscape 3:1)

Both should be perfectly suitable for Twitter and most other socials! The PIC comes with a few pre-determined backgrounds, created by all kinds of different artists. Some of them have even been graciously provided by other projects such as **Animetas** and Bitlectroâ€™s **Dreamers**. Big thanks to them for being willing to do so!

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/e-K6K6-Hg-WlnmP0JQp5-.png?height=233&width=700)

Currently, the PIC supports the Genesis Pixls collection, but once we release the Pixlton Car Club weâ€™ll be sure to integrate the cars too. That way you can show off your Pixltonians and their rides all in one awesome banner!

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kOF00FuWoqC2f4gMzv3JG.png?height=500&width=500)

## Get started today!

Create your own cool avatars and banners and show them off, today! Feel free to tag us on Twitter when you show off your creations and weâ€™ll be happy to RT them. Happy tinkering!
